poem:
**Obituary for a Maverick**

In frames of grit and ink,  
Phil drew shadows where light feared,  
spinning tales of cowboys and commandments  
with a laugh as dark as coal.  
Independence his horse, wit his spurs—  
He rode the wild plains of animation,  
leaving a trail of bold line work,  
etching eternity in flickering frames.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Phil Mulloy obituary Phil Mulloy, my life partner, who has died aged 76, was one of Britain’s most fiercely independent voices in animation, known for the dark wit and distinctive visual style of his films. He found international acclaim with Cowboys (1991), a series of six short films that parodied westerns and masculinity, and were produced by Channel 4 and the Arts Council. Later his Ten Commandments shorts (1994–96) and the Intolerance trilogy (2000–04) offered". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
